page.title: 16Tumuli
page.content: Viewed from the air the most striking thing about the area is the vast network of ancient field systems and tumuli.These date back to the Bronze Age showing that the area was well populated at that time.There are over 100 tumuli in our area.The majority are bowl barrows but there are saucer, disc and bell barrows.Many of the barrows have been damaged or destroyed by ploughing, but others have revealed whole skeletons and ashes showing that burial and cremation were practised.Many of the barrows had pottery urns in them some with and some without human remains. One barrow revealed 3 skeletons in a sitting position plus one extra large one whilst another had 1 burial a cremation plus incense cup, a bronze awl, amber beads, cowrie shells and a bone pin.
